title.narrative: Southeast area of the Western Forest Conservation Complex (WEFCOM), Kanchanaburi province, west Thailand

description.narrative: 'The purpose of this proposal is to enable the recovery and protection of tigers and tiger prey in Salakpra Wildlife Sanctuary. This will be done by networking with the Department of National Parks and other NGO tiger researchers to develop the capacity in the Salakpra Zoological Society of London (ZSL)/Elephant Conservation Network (ECN) team and relevant rangers to undertake basic tiger surveys; acquiring baseline data on tiger and tiger prey distribution and densities in Salakpra; and supporting the integration of tiger survey findings into the Salakpra patrol system. Specifically, this will include: 1) recruiting a project assistant; 2) providing equipment to the tiger team needed to implement the project; 3) arranging a five day field course on tiger and tiger prey survey techniques in Huai Kha Khaeng for the tiger team and relevant rangers; 4) carrying out a 4 day study trip for the tiger team (about 12 people) to another tiger site (e.g. Thap Lan NP) that uses similar tiger survey techniques to those planned for this project; 5) implementing the camera-trap surveys for tigers; 6) implementing the ungulate surveys to measure ungulate occupancy; 7) logging the data from the camera-traps and foot surveys into the database; 8) analyzing the data on a regular basis so it is available for patrol planning and deployment; 9) providing feedback at Salakpra’s Protected Area Committee management meetings to ensure that findings of this project are integrated into the Salakpra management and protection system; and 10) organizing a tiger conservation network gathering at the end of the project to share findings with project advisors and their tiger team colleagues in order to discuss future collaborations and ‘what next?’ '

description.narrative: The United States is engaging Thailand primarily as a development partner to leverage its significant resources as an upper middle income country to encourage it to take a greater leadership role in addressing global and regional challenges of mutual concern. Throughout its modern history as a constitutional monarchy, Thailand has experienced years of political uncertainty, including, most recently, a military coup in May 2014 following six months of protests, the dissolution of parliament, and failed national elections. Such dramatic shifts in the political system are disruptive for a key U.S. ally and make clear that there is a continued need for engagement in priority areas with U.S. support for good governance and transnational rule of law. Many political, legal, and criminal justice institutions are still developing and will benefit from continued U.S. engagement. Achieving U.S. strategic goals in Thailand and in the region is predicated on the country's stability. U.S. assistance will promote peace and security, foster reforms and modernization of the criminal justice system, and strengthen good governance.
